intro: Bupleurum wightii var. ramosissimum, commonly known as the hairy bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. It is commonly found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
